results.title: Hope
results.creator_credit: Rowena Ashley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether in the city or a small town, Rowena Ashley’s son Michael has had to endure racism from a young age. This is a story about achieving against the odds. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rowena Ashley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Vivianne Everett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Chance decision
results.creator_credit: Graham Goulding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A chance decision led Graham Goulding into a teaching job in China where the banquets were endless and he and his colleagues were treated like royalty. A unique adventure that has remained with Goulding long after his return to Gippsland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Goulding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.
results.title_for_label: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.
description_for_label: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.

results.title: Waterholes : our turn
results.creator_credit: Kaye Munroe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kaye Munroe remembers the day the devastating Gippsland bushfires came to her doorstep. The ‘travelling fingers’ of the bushfire threatened not only her home but the beauty of the area she loved. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kaye Munroe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: My nightmare has just begun
results.creator_credit: Linda Lord, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Lord recounts the day the Gippsland bushfires came to her home. Despite undergoing fire training and preparation, when the fire front approached, there was no time to think. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Going, going, still here!
results.creator_credit: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Garry Hammer and his family battle the Gippsland bushfires to save their home.
Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description:
Garry Hammer and his family battle the Gippsland bushfires to save their home.
Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

results.title: Floods through fire
results.creator_credit: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lynda Code recalls the hardships of living through the Gippsland bushfires then having to cope with devastating floods. Her story of resiliance is a tribute to her family, who have battled along with her. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
